text:
Flying

editions.flavor:
"Only a knife left for a fortnight in the hollow of a ghastbark tree can inflict a wound so grave."
—Kithkin superstition

name: Blood Knight
text: First strike, protection from white

editions.flavor: His is the fury of the wildfire, the boiling blood of the volcano. He fights you not because you've wronged him, but because you're there.

name: Bloodletter
text: When the names of three or more nonland permanents begin with the same letter, sacrifice Bloodletter. If you do, it deals 2 damage to each creature and each player.

editions.flavor:
"That's not an A, it's an Æ. Wait, don't—"
—Hœbrus Væm, Ærathi librarian, last words

text: {T}: Choose a creature type. Reveal the top card of your library. If that card is a creature card of the chosen type, put it into your hand. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

name: Blood Mist

editions.flavor: "Some claim that rage is a cloud that obscures thought and vision. But I can assure you—I've never seen with greater clarity."

name: Blood of the Martyr
text: Until end of turn, if damage would be dealt to any creature, you may have that damage dealt to you instead.

editions.flavor: The willow knows what the storm does not: that the power to endure harm outlives the power to inflict it.
The willow knows what the storm does not: that the power to endure harm outlives the power to inflict it.

name: Blood Ogre
text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor:
"Ogres taunt the dragons by moving into their territory, but even the hellkites find them too much trouble to hunt."

name: Blood Pet
text: Sacrifice Blood Pet: Add {B} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: "You are wrong," Volrath said. "I do not hate the living. They often prove quite useful to me." And then he laughed.

name: Bloodpyre Elemental
text: Sacrifice Bloodpyre Elemental: Bloodpyre Elemental deals 4 damage to target creature. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: Elementals born of Jund are as cruel and unstable as the plane itself.

name: Bloodrage Vampire
text: Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: The most genteel facades hide the most abominable desires.
The most genteel facades hide the most abominable desires.

name: Blood Reckoning
text: Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, that creature's controller loses 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"There is no greater folly than standing against me."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Bloodrite Invoker
text: {8}: Target player loses 3 life and you gain 3 life.

editions.flavor:
"The brood lineages unfolded across the world, each patterned after one of three progenitors, each a study in mindless consumption."

name: Blood Rites
text: {1}{R}, Sacrifice a creature: Blood Rites deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:

In war, the best leaders are open to all tactics.

name: Bloodrock Cyclops

text: Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

editions.flavor: It tracks its victims by the scent of their breath, preferring to dine on those who recently ate well.

name: Bloodscent
text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.

editions.flavor: To study the predators of the Tangle, two people are required: one to watch from above, and one to run like hell.

name: Blood Scrivener
text: If you would draw a card while you have no cards in hand, instead draw two cards and lose 1 life.

editions.flavor: Make sure you bleed the fine print.

name: Blood Seeker
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under an opponent's control, you may have that player lose 1 life.

editions.flavor: A drop now is all he needs to find you later.
A drop now is all he needs to find you later.

name: Bloodshed Fever
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature attacks each turn if able.

editions.flavor: Cinder mages enjoy seeing their victims in the throes of bloodlust—and seeing the regret that inevitably follows.

name: Bloodshot Cyclops

editions.flavor: After their first encounter, the goblins named him Chuck.

Haste

'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave;
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.

'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.
The bodies of its victims are the only tracks it leaves.
It moved through the troops leaving no footprints, save on their souls.

'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.

'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.
She died in this swamp, and so will you.

'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.

'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.
The bodies of its victims are the only tracks it leaves.

'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.
It moved through the troops leaving no footprints, save on their souls.
Knowing Takenuma Swamp to be dangerous, Hisata set wards to warn him of predators. He never imagined that his murderer would pass through them unhindered.

name: Bog Wreckage
text:
Bog Wreckage enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Bog Wreckage: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Boil
text: Destroy all Islands.

editions.flavor:
"The fishers will throw out their nets and draw them back filled with dust."
—Oracle en-Vec

"The fishers will throw out their nets and draw them back filled with dust."
—Oracle en-Vec

"It is a slaughter, the death of a sea. Never speak of it again."
—The Lord of Atlantis
"When every reef is bared and every wave is dust—only then shall I rest."
